ovdesc.p: The Group Debit Interest Table allows the specification of a calculation method of debit interest for groups of accounts and provides the link to the GENERAL.CHARGE table where the charges applicable to the same groups of Accounts are specified. Account groups are determined automatically on the basis of Customer and Account details such as Residence, Sector, Account Category and Currency. At the time of Account input, reference is made to ACCT.GEN.CONDITION and CONDITION PRIORITY (Ref: General Tables) tables. From these, a General Condition code is derived for later access to the GROUP.DEBIT.INT table. (For further information, see the ACCT.GEN.Condition and CONDITION.PRIORITY tables.)
- Interest can be calculated on a Daily, Average, or Highest balance basis using value dated balances.
- Rates can be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

- Different rates can be specified for different balance levels and may be linked to the same or different basic rates. The rates may apply to the whole of the balance or to the part between two balance levels.

- Using Group Level Conditions, it is possible to use the limits on individual Accounts as the first level for debit interest so that one rate can be charged up to the limit on any Account and another rate when the limit has been exceeded. (Limits on individual Accounts are specified in the ACCOUNT.DEBIT.LIMIT Table.) In this case a maximum of 2 rates may be specified.
Where special debit interest conditions apply to a specific account, reference should be made to the table ACCOUNT.DEBIT.INT table.

desc.p: Identifies either a Tax record (defined in TAX table) or Tax.Type.Condition record with a "*" symbol prefixed to a valid tax.type.condition which specifies the calculation and processing of tax, applicable to debit interest. If tax rate is given then tax is calculated on the associated group of accounts. If a Tax Type Condition Identifier is specified, the system will derive the applicable TAX.CODE from the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION based on the customer grouping. (tax.type.condition allows to define different tax rates for different tax.gen.condition records). Input of tax.type.condition helps in deducting different rates of tax for different group of customers in the associated group of accounts.

1-2 numeric characters. (Optional input. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains 'NONE'.) There must be an existing record for this code on the TAX table (Ref: General Tables) with an effective date not later than the effective date of this record.

For computation of tax JOINT HOLDER wise for an account based on their tax status, only a valid TAX.TYPE.CONDITION ID has to be specified along with a local routine in CALC.ROUTINE field. eg. *CGT has to be specified.
The TAX.OPERAND in the corresponding Tax record should be PLUS
This is a General Condition code and date, which identifies the Group Debit Interest record and the date from which it applies.
The General Condition code must have an associated record present on the ACCT.GEN.CONDITION file.
The corresponding CONCAT record in file GROUP.DATE will be updated.

(Mandatory if numeric Currency Code and date entered, otherwise not input). e) 1-9 date characters. (Optional input. Default is todays date.)
Determines whether the calculation will be performed up to the debit balance 'Level' or in 'Bands' (where the interest calculation employed is dependent upon the size of debit balance).

If more than one set of fields DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT are input, this indicates that a different interest rate is applicable depending on the size of the debit balance. DR CALCUL TYPE specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each Band of the debit balance or one is to be made on the entire balance, dependent on the Level of the balance.
Example: Assume a debit balance of 15,000 and a Group Debit Interest record which specifies an applicable rate of 10 per cent up to 10,000 and 15 per cent above 10,000.
If Band is specified, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e.
10 per cent on 10,000 15 per cent on 5,000
If Level is specified, 1 calculation will be performed, i.e.
15 per cent on 15,000.

'BAND' or 'LEVEL' or any abbreviaton thereof. (Mandatory input if more than one set of fields DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT are specified, otherwise optional. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS, contains 'NONE'.)

Specifies a floating Basic Rate which is held on the BASIC.INTEREST table (Ref: General Tables). Fields DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT are used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits.

1-4 numeric characters. Multivalue Field associated with fields DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Not allowed if corresponding DR.INT.RATE, is input or if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS, contains 'NONE'.) There must be a record in the BASIC.INTEREST table with a key consisting of this code, the Currency of the Account and an effective date which is less than or equal to the date specified in Field 0, (Record ID). Examples: The rate or rates of interest which will be applied are defined by the following multivalue group of fields: BASIC RATE INT RATE MARGIN OPER MARGIN RATE LIMIT AMOUNT Examples of their use is as follows: 1) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, only enter the following field: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate. 2) If the interest rate is to be fixed, only enter the following field: INT RATE - the actual rate of interest. 3) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate plus a fixed margin; enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Base Rate MARGIN OPER - 'ADD' MARGIN RATE - Margin Rate to be added. 4) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate Plus a Percentage of the floating Basic Rate; enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'MULTIPLY' MARGIN RATE - Percentage to be added 5) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, plus a Margin up to a limiting amount and a floating Basic Rate, plus a different Margin above that limiting amount, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'ADD' MARGIN RATE - 1st Margin Rate LIMIT AMOUNT- The limit amount for the above defined Rate BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'ADD' MARGIN RATE - 2nd Margin Rate

Specifies the applicable General Charge Record which defines the charges and overrides applicable to the Group of Accounts.
The General Charge record which is in effect on the date of the debit interest capitalisation specifies the interest related chrges applicable to the whole capitalisation period.
The General charge record which is in effect on the date of the charges capitalisation specifies the account ledger charges applicable ot the whole capitalisation period.
Note : No Ledger Fee Charges are calculated for the month in which an Account is opened or closed (unless the Account Closure date is the last day of the month).
1-4 numeric character General Charge code. (Mandatory input) There must be a record in the GENERAL.CHARGE table for this code, with an effective date not later than the effective date of this record.
Optional values of DAILY, WEEKn, Mnn or Nnn can be input to specify the
number of compounding periods per year.
If left blank, no compounding will occur.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
There are 3 options (YES, BLOCK.MARGIN and NO/Blank)
Blank or NO
Indicates that negative rates cannot be input and if a rate becomes negative as a result of the application of a margin the rate will be set to zero
YES
Indicates that negative rates can be input and if the application margin makes the rate more negative
then the more negative rate will be used.
BLOCK.MARGIN
Indicates that negative rates can be used but the following conditions apply
- If the rate is positive and the margin makes the rate negative then the rate will be set to zero
- If the rate is negative and the margin makes the rate more negative then the margin will be ignored and the original negative rate is used
- If the total debit interest on capitalisation is a debit to the customer then update AC.PENDING as per the exsisting functionality
- If the total debit interest on capitalisation is a credit to the customer then the interest will be posted directly to the customer account

- If correction takes place for a debit interest which results in a credit to the customer account and we have an AC.PENDING record present then AC.PENDING record is updated with the negative amount and the interest pending processing would then do the correct interest posting based on the dates defined.
